newsitem.title: POLAND: Espebepe extends loss on debt deal delay.
newsitem.headline: Espebepe extends loss on debt deal delay.

text.p: Polish construction firm Espebepe SA tumbled 9.6 percent to 5.65 zlotys, extending Monday's plunge, after a decision on its possible debt write-off deal was postponed until April 14, traders said.
Espebepe did not trade after price fixing for the second consecutive session due to excess supply.
"After the creditors' meeting was postponed many fear the company will go bankrupt, so they desparately want to sell the shares," one trader said.
Some traders said that if Espebepe's high supply of shares continued on Wednesday the bourse might decide to let the stock trade without the regular 10-percent limit on daily price changes.
Espebepe's creditors met on Friday to decide on whether to offer the company a debt-relief scheme but the meeting was deemed invalid because of procedural reasons and called again for April 14.
